PathAssistant.masterLabel: Draft from Client Template Legal Review

pathAssistantSteps.info: The client or other party signs the Agreement, if acceptable.  If the Agreement is sent by the Researcher to the client or other party, as agreed with the Research Office Contact, the email and a copy of the Agreement is to be uploaded by the Researcher to the Researcher Portal (Related Tab under Files Tab) and notifies the Research Office contact via chatter.
The Agreement is closed as it did not proceed to execution due to cancellation or withdrawal.
The Research Office reviews and updates the client or other party's Agreement ready for Legal Review. The Research Office Contact will contact the Researcher if there are further questions.

The client or other party returns the fully executed Agreement to the Research Office. The Research Office notifies the Researcher (via chatter) and a fully executed Agreement is uploaded to the Researcher Portal. If the fully executed Agreement has been returned to the Researcher, the Researcher uploads the email and a copy of the fully executed Agreement to the Researcher Portal (Related Tab under Files Tab) and notifies the Research Office contact via chatter.
The Research Office organises signing of the Agreement by an authorised signatory, once all parties have agreed to changes.
The Research Office refers the Agreement to Legal Services. Legal Services reviews the client or other party's Agreement and provides advice to the Research Office Contact and Researcher.

The Research Office prepares instructions including Agreement timelines, milestones, project budget, intellectual property position, publication requirements and deliverables/outputs. The Research Office completes the Legal Checklist. The Research Office will contact the Researcher to clarify or to provide further details, if required.

The Research Office sends the draft Agreement to the Researcher for their review or requests further instructions from the Researcher, if required. If the Agreement requires changes, the Research Office will send the updated Agreement to the client or other party for their consideration (or by the Researcher if agreed by the Research Office Contact). If the Agreement is sent by the the Researcher to the client or other party, as agreed with the Research Office Contact, the email and a copy of the Agreement is to be uploaded by the Researcher to the Researcher Portal (Related Tab under Files tab). When the Agreement is acceptable by both parties, the Research Office Contact will organise signing.
The Research Office sends the Agreement to the client or other party once it has been signed by La Trobe's authorised signatory (with a copy to the Researcher).

The Research Office sends the Agreement to the client or other party (with a copy to the Researcher). If the Agreement is sent by the Researcher to the client or other party, as agreed with the Research Office Contact, the email and a copy of the Agreement is to be uploaded by the Researcher to the Researcher Portal (Related Tab under Files tab). The client or other party may decide to sign the Agreement at this stage, if acceptable.
The Research Office reviews Legal Services advice and updates the client or other party's Agreement.
